1.quote: It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?
1.author: Henry David Thoreau

2.quote: To do a great and important work, two things are necessary — a definite plan, and not quite enough time.
2.author: Unknown

3.quote: People often ask me if I know the secret of success and if I could tell others how to make their dreams come true. My answer is, you do it by working.
3.author: Walt Disney

4.quote: As soon as something stops being fun, I think it’s time to move on. Life is too short to be unhappy. Waking up stressed and miserable is not a good way to live.
4.author: Richard Branson

5.quote: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
5.author: Babe Ruth

6.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed, is more important than any other one thing.
6.author: Abraham Lincoln

7.quote: Much of the stress that people feel doesn't come from having too much to do. It comes from not finishing what they've started.
7.author: David Allen

8.quote: Failure is only the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently. There is no disgrace in honest failure; there is disgrace in fearing to fail.
8.author: Henry Ford

9.quote: You can’t be that kid standing at the top of the waterslide, overthinking it. You have to go down the chute.
9.author: Tina Fey

10.quote: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
10.author: Dale Carnegie

11.quote: Nobody works better under pressure. They just work faster.
11.author: Brian Tracy

12.quote: Before everything else, getting ready is the secret of success.
12.author: Henry Ford

13.quote: Start with the end in mind.
13.author: Stephen R. Covey

14.quote: Lost time is never found again.
14.author: Benjamin Franklin

15.quote: I am rather like a mosquito in a nudist camp; I know what I want to do, but I don’t know where to begin.
15.author: David Allen

16.quote: One good thing about procrastination is that you always have something planned for tomorrow.
16.author: GB Stern

17.quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday
17.author: Don Marquis

18.quote: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.
18.author: Émile Zola

20.quote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
20.author: George Orwell

21.quote: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
21.author: Dale Carnegie

22.quote: The only way to get what you want in this world is through hard work.
22.author: Tiana (Princess and the Frog)
